trans-unit.source: Partitioning Service Fabric Services
trans-unit.target: Partitioning Service Fabric Services

trans-unit.source: Describes how to partition Service Fabric services
trans-unit.target: Describes how to partition Service Fabric services

trans-unit.source: Partitioning Service Fabric services
trans-unit.target: Partitioning Service Fabric services

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric makes it easy to build scalable stateful services by supporting partitioning of the service state and having each partition operate on a subset of the total state.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric makes it easy to build scalable stateful services by supporting partitioning of the service state and having each partition operate on a subset of the total state.

trans-unit.source: Each partition becomes a unit that is made <link><linkText>highly available</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Each partition becomes a unit that is made <link><linkText>highly available</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The replicas of partitions are distributed across the nodes in the cluster and are balanced.
trans-unit.target: The replicas of partitions are distributed across the nodes in the cluster and are balanced.

trans-unit.source: While Stateless Services can also be partitioned this scenario is rare and unnecessary for most Service Fabric services.
trans-unit.target: While Stateless Services can also be partitioned this scenario is rare and unnecessary for most Service Fabric services.

trans-unit.source: There are three different partitioning schemes available.
trans-unit.target: There are three different partitioning schemes available.

trans-unit.source: Singleton Partitioning Scheme
trans-unit.target: Singleton Partitioning Scheme

trans-unit.source: This is used to specify that the service does not need partitioning.
trans-unit.target: This is used to specify that the service does not need partitioning.

trans-unit.source: Named Partitioning Scheme
trans-unit.target: Named Partitioning Scheme

trans-unit.source: This is used to specify a fixed set of names for each partition of the service.
trans-unit.target: This is used to specify a fixed set of names for each partition of the service.

trans-unit.source: Individual partitions can be looked up by their name.
trans-unit.target: Individual partitions can be looked up by their name.

trans-unit.source: Ranged Partitioning Scheme
trans-unit.target: Ranged Partitioning Scheme

trans-unit.source: This is used to specify an integer range (identified by a low and a high key) and a number of partitions (n).
trans-unit.target: This is used to specify an integer range (identified by a low and a high key) and a number of partitions (n).

trans-unit.source: It creates n partitions, each responsible for a non-overlapping subrange.
trans-unit.target: It creates n partitions, each responsible for a non-overlapping subrange.

trans-unit.source: Example: A ranged partitioning scheme (for a service with three replicas) with a low key of 0, a high key of 99 and a count of 4 would create 4 partitions as shown below.
trans-unit.target: Example: A ranged partitioning scheme (for a service with three replicas) with a low key of 0, a high key of 99 and a count of 4 would create 4 partitions as shown below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Range Partitioning</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Range Partitioning</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The common case is to create a hash for a unique key within a dataset.
trans-unit.target: The common case is to create a hash for a unique key within a dataset.

trans-unit.source: Some common examples of keys would be a vehicle identification number (VIN), employee ID, or a unique string.
trans-unit.target: Some common examples of keys would be a vehicle identification number (VIN), employee ID, or a unique string.

trans-unit.source: Using that unique key you would then create a long hash code, modulus the key range, to use as your key.
trans-unit.target: Using that unique key you would then create a long hash code, modulus the key range, to use as your key.

trans-unit.source: You can specify upper and lower bounds of the allowed key range.
trans-unit.target: You can specify upper and lower bounds of the allowed key range.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you should estimate the number of partitions high enough to handle worst-case resource load (such as memory limitations or network bandwidth) but not so much that partitions are extremely sparse.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you should estimate the number of partitions high enough to handle worst-case resource load (such as memory limitations or network bandwidth) but not so much that partitions are extremely sparse.

trans-unit.source: Selecting a hash algorithm
trans-unit.target: Selecting a hash algorithm

trans-unit.source: An important part of hashing is selecting your hash algorithm.
trans-unit.target: An important part of hashing is selecting your hash algorithm.

trans-unit.source: An important consideration is whether the goal is to group similar keys near each other (Locality sensitive hashing), or if activity should be distributed broadly across all partitions (Distribution Hashing).
trans-unit.target: An important consideration is whether the goal is to group similar keys near each other (Locality sensitive hashing), or if activity should be distributed broadly across all partitions (Distribution Hashing).

trans-unit.source: A good resource for general hash code algorithm choices is <link><linkText>the Wikipedia page on Hash Functions</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A good resource for general hash code algorithm choices is <link><linkText>the Wikipedia page on Hash Functions</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: It is not possible to change the number of partitions or the type of partitioning scheme used for a service after it has been created.
trans-unit.target: It is not possible to change the number of partitions or the type of partitioning scheme used for a service after it has been created.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: For information on Service Fabric concepts, see the following:

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Availability of Service Fabric Services</linkText><title></title></link>
